newsitem.title: ITALY: Captain of Italy's Albania flagship replaced.
newsitem.headline: Captain of Italy's Albania flagship replaced.

text.p: The captain of an Italian navy flagship which ran aground off Albania last month has stepped down from his post three months early, the navy said on Friday.

The Vittorio Veneto ignominiously hit the headlines when it became stuck on a sandbank off the southern Albanian port of Vlore as troops from an Italian-led force arrived on a humanitarian mission in the troubled Balkan state.
Navy officials said Captain Vincenzo De Fanis, who had been due to stay in command of the ship until August, had asked to leave his post early and the request had been granted.
He had been replaced by Captain Giuseppe De Giorgi. The officials gave no further details.
The Vittorio Veneto is now in the southern Italian port of Taranto undergoing routine work, and will soon resume operational duties.
The ship suffered no serious damage on the sandbank and an inquiry is under way into how the incident happened.
